column4: Where's the best place to ask about writing upstart jobs? Can anyone here help?
http://www.linux.com/archive/feature/125977?theme=print might be of use

Thanks! Different than I had before. I need to run a script before networking and UFW start. Seems the only way is to have my script trigger on a networking event, then trigger ufw on my custom event - but that doesn't seem elegant. Ideas?
you could have it trigger on the start of the system and have networking require it
require it? It's even driven. do you know how to do that?
use "start on started <jobname>"
I'm  not sure if that would work though
I think upstart still launches a SysV-like set of init scripts like most other linux distributions use
I see that networking.conf in 9.10 has a start line with a parenthesis. Do you know if that means both event contitions have to be satisfied before it fires, or either?
I don't know
what does the line look like?
Yes, it does... and my script is a regular init script now... but it doesn't reliably run before ufw.
start on (local-filesystem  and stopped udevtrigger)
it means that it starts after local-filesystem has been triggered and udevtrigger has been stopped
Hmmmmm, maybe I can add another line there to make it require my custom event, too.
you probably could
there might be another way to do it by managing the init scripts
